newsitem.title: USA: Crestar, Grad & Walker in deal.
newsitem.headline: Crestar, Grad & Walker in deal.

text.p: Crestar Energy Inc said early Wednesday that it has an agreement to acquire Grad & Walker Energy Corp in a deal worth about $336.2 million.
Under the deal, Crestar would acquire Grad & Walker in exchange for $13.50 cash or, at the election of depositing shareholders, 0.509 Crestar common shares for each Grad & Walker common share.
A maximum of 5 million Crestar common shares will be available under the share election. If all Grad & Walker common shares are tendered, the value of the offer will be about $336.2 million, it said.

As recently as Monday, Crestar Chief Executive Barry Jackson said the company did not have a deal for Grad & Walker. Crestar operates in areas close to Grad & Walker's, which include the Marengo and Mantario East oil plays in southwestern Saskatchewan and Three Hills Creek in central Alberta.

Grad & Walker Resources Ltd, a holding company, and certain officers and directors of Grad & Walker, who collectively hold about 21 percent of the outstanding Grad & Walker shares on a fully diluted basis, have agreed to deposit and not withdraw their Grad & Walker shares under the offer.
Crestar's offer has the unanimous support of the boards of directors of both companies.
Grad & Walker has agreed to pay Crestar a non-completion fee of 2.8 percent plus costs in certain circumstances and has agreed not to solicit other transaction proposals, the companies said.
